<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/12/coinbase-is-launching-an-nft-marketplace?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Coinbase Joins the NFT Party
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/12/coinbase-is-launching-an-nft-marketplace?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A frame around the Coinbase logo" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/3935660c68c08bd0be4cbe2ee79023b21daa9a49-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Coinbase is launching a marketplace for <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/24/nft-frequently-asked-questions?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NFTs</a>—which, yes, we’re still talking about.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On the marketplace, called <a href="https://blog.coinbase.com/coinbase-nft-is-coming-soon-join-the-waitlist-today-for-early-access-cc7bac29fd72?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Coinbase NFT</a>, users will be able to buy, sell, and mint NFTs, or tokens that verify you’re the owner of a digital asset. Coinbase also said it would include “social features” and pitched the platform as more user-friendly than the other guys.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The “other guys” include two rival cryptocurrency exchanges: Binance and FTX, which both recently launched their own NFT marketplaces. But they’re all just guppies compared to OpenSea—which has a <a href="https://www.readthegeneralist.com/briefing/opensea?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">97% stranglehold</a> of the NFT market. In the past month alone, OpenSea facilitated nearly $2.8 billion in NFT transactions, per DappRadar.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What do companies see in NFTs?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">NFTs have survived and even grown beyond their “fidget spinner” phase this spring, when the digital artist Beeple sold an NFT at Christie's for $69 million. Google searches <a href="https://trends.google.com/trends/explore?q=NFT&geo=US" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">flagged</a> for months after, but interest has climbed back up since...perhaps best exemplified by an NFT of a rock selling for over <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/23/justin-sun-buys-nft-rock-half-million-dollars?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">half a mil</a> at the end of August.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, it’s not just your old college roommate who believes NFTs have a bright future.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Visa </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-23/cryptopunk-nft-prices-visa-buys-digital-avatar-7610-for-150-000-in-eth?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">planted its flag</a></span><span> in the NFT world this summer by purchasing a CryptoPunk—a unique digital avatar—for $150,000 worth of ethereum.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg thinks NFTs could be a ubiquitous part of the metaverse he’s intent on building.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Skeptics say the NFT space is plagued by scams and is essentially a hype bubble ready to burst.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Coinbase’s stock has fallen 27% since it went public in April, as competitors like Robinhood crowd into crypto trading and regulators bare their teeth. Coinbase NFT marks the company’s second shot at finding a new revenue stream in about a month, after the SEC scrapped its last launch—a crypto lending product called Lend.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>anyone can join Coinbase’s waitlist for its NFT marketplace, which the company plans to <a href="https://www.coinbase.com/nft/announce?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launch this year</a>. *Adds <em>Pudgy Penguin</em> to Christmas list.*<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/12/americans-quit-their-jobs-at-a-record-rate-in-august?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Americans Are Done With Their Crappy Jobs
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/12/americans-quit-their-jobs-at-a-record-rate-in-august?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Peggy from Mad Men quitting her job" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/e0938586965b99e4d1b72059ee151cfd0830e70a-888x489.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mad Men</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">4.3 million people <a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-459c0884721a213985cdf0185a1176f8?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">quit their jobs</a> in the US in August, the Labor Department said yesterday. That’s an astronomical amount—the most on record—and represents nearly 3% of the workforce.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Where are workers <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/10/12/jolts-workers-quitting-august-pandemic/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">quitting the most</a>?</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>892,000 workers left restaurants, bars, and hotels.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>721,000 left their retail gigs.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>706,000 ditched their jobs in professional business services and 534,000 in health care and social assistance.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s going on? </strong>In an economy where jobs are plentiful and the people to fill them are scarce, workers are finding themselves with much more leverage. If their jobs are uber stressful, require long hours for low pay, and pose a greater risk of contracting Covid-19, there’s little incentive to stick around. Just look at the number of people quitting the hospitality and retail industries.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>This is all a major headache for employers, who have to raise wages and dangle more benefits to find anyone to work for them. Businesses had 10.4 million job openings in the country in August, down from July’s record of 11.1 million but still extremely elevated.<em>—NF</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/12/health-panel-says-older-healthy-americans-should-not-take-daily-aspirin?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Medical Leaders: Healthy Boomers Shouldn't Take Daily Aspirin
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well, they didn’t put it exactly like that. But in a draft statement, the US Preventive Services Task Force, a leading group of medical experts, did say that people age 60 or over should <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/12/health/aspirin-heart-attack-stroke.html?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stop taking</a> a daily regimen of low-dose aspirin to prevent heart disease or stroke.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Because aspirin acts as a blood thinner to prevent blood clots, it also increases the risk of life-threatening bleeding. So the panel decided that the potential side effects for older folks taking aspirin daily as a preventative measure outweigh the benefits.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>This announcement isn’t exactly a </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/10/12/health/daily-aspirin-heart-disease-stroke-draft-recommendation-wellness/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surprise</a></span><span>, and comes after a number of medical organizations, such as the American Heart Association, said older Americans without high risk of heart disease should forgo daily low-dose aspirin.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>But,</em> people 60 or older who are taking aspirin for a previous heart attack or stroke should continue to pop the pills, the task force said.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat to go:</strong> Heart disease is the leading cause of death in the US, responsible for about a quarter of all deaths.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TOGETHER WITH FIDELITY INVESTMENTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<font color="#000000">
Love, SPACtually
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/508014547;309282911;e" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Fidelity Investments" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://media2.morningbrew.com/uploads/placement/images/4197/1632169343-Newsletter_AttackOfTheSPACs_1506883558_Fidelity.png">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’ve been reading this newsletter in the past year or two, you’ve definitely heard about a SPAC or two...after all, there were over 300 in Q1 alone. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So where’d all that momentum come from, especially for a method of going public that’s been around for years? And why did that momentum slow to a crawl in Q2? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s what we explored in <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/508018699;309281162;n" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Episode 5</a> of Season 2 of Fresh Invest, our investing-focused podcast powered by Fidelity. If you want to figure out what’s SPACtually going on with this new type of IPO, you should definitely listen in. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Morning Brew Executive Chairman Alex Lieberman sat down with John Gagliardi of Fidelity Investments to work through those questions. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You’ll find out what SPAC stands for, why they’re appealing for both sponsors and targets, and why they’ve been attracting criticism in recent months. This is a good one—<a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/508018699;309281162;n" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">listen right here</a>.</p>
</td>

</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/12/key-performance-indicators-october-13?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>If you're wondering why the line for Cava is getting so long, an average of 36% of the US workforce was <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/return-of-office-workers-reaches-pandemic-high-as-employees-trickle-in-11634031001?mod=hp_lead_pos1" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">back in the office</a> last week in 10 major cities monitored by Kastle Systems. It’s the largest share of workers going into the office since the pandemic began.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> “Kyrie has made a personal choice and we respect his individual right to choose. Currently, the choice restricts his ability to be a full-time member of the team…”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Kyrie Irving saga <a href="https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/32387481/brooklyn-nets-say-kyrie-irving-play-practice-eligible-local-covid-19-vaccination-mandate?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ramped up</a> yesterday, when the Brooklyn Nets released a statement saying the star basketball player couldn’t play or practice with the team until he abides by NYC’s Covid-19 guidelines. Irving is not vaccinated.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The fascinating business behind 15-minute or less grocery delivery. <table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRANSPORTATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/12/the-future-of-biking-vanmoof-v?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Future of Biking Might Not Be Tandem <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/pensive-face_1f614.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/12/the-future-of-biking-vanmoof-v?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A depiction of the VanMoof V e-bike" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/66a964a8fadaaeb374e626ad64255e895d080f53-3840x2159.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>VanMoof</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">VanMoof, the Dutch e-bike manufacturer, will begin selling a high-speed bike called the VanMoof V in late 2022, the company announced Tuesday. Maxing out at <a href="https://www.vanmoof.com/en-US/vanmoof-v?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">37 mph</a>, the V is gonna be huge for those of us with dreams of one day cheating to win the Tour de France.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One potential hiccup: The V’s 37-mph speed is significantly faster than the legal limit for e-bikes in any US state with a law currently on the books (some states have no limit at all). In a press release, the company said it “intends to work with city governments to explore solutions from geofencing to revised speed regulations.” Basically a “do first, ask forgiveness after they’ve seen us do a wheelie on this hog” kind of thing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> The e-bike market is expected to reach <a href="https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2021/04/06/2204781/0/en/Global-e-bike-market-size-to-reach-USD-48-46-billion-by-2028.html?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$48 billion</a> globally by 2028. E-bike sales in the US  increased <a href="https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2021/03/electric-bicycles-sales-growth/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">145%</a> between 2019 and 2020, and grew <a href="https://electrek.co/2021/10/05/electric-bicycle-sales-are-growing16x-higher-than-general-cycling-heres-why/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">240%</a> in the 12 months leading up to July 2021. For context, that’s 16x faster growth than general cycling.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The VanMoof V will retail for approximately $3,600, and deliveries are expected to start in late 2022.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Do you think you can tell the difference between a Kanye West tweet and an Elon Musk tweet? It’s harder than it sounds. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Word Search: </strong>See if you can identify the artist from their most famous painting. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/12/word-search-artists?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Play it here</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">William Shatner Trivia</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Professional actor and amateur astronaut William Shatner is best known for his role in <em>Star Trek</em>, but do you remember the other movies he's appeared in? We’ll give you the character he played and the year the film was released; you guess the movie.</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Dodgeball Chancellor (2004)</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Veteran MC Stan Fields (2000)</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ozzie, a Virginia opossum (2006)</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Attorney Denny Crane (1997) → this is a TV show, btw</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Mayor Phlegmming, the leader of the "City of Frank" (2001)</span></li>

for \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/24/nft-frequently-asked-questions?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNFTs\u003c/a\u003e—which, yes, we’re still talking about.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn the marketplace, called \u003ca href=\"https://blog.coinbase.com/coinbase-nft-is-coming-soon-join-the-waitlist-today-for-early-access-cc7bac29fd72?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCoinbase NFT\u003c/a\u003e, users will be able to buy, sell, and mint NFTs, or tokens that verify you’re the owner of a digital asset. Coinbase also said it would include “social features” and pitched the platform as more user-friendly than the other guys.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe “other guys” include two rival cryptocurrency exchanges: Binance and FTX, which both recently launched their own NFT marketplaces. But they’re all just guppies compared to OpenSea—which has a \u003ca href=\"https://www.readthegeneralist.com/briefing/opensea?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e97% stranglehold\u003c/a\u003e of the NFT market. In the past month alone, OpenSea facilitated nearly $2.8 billion in NFT transactions, per DappRadar.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat do companies see in NFTs?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNFTs have survived and even grown beyond their “fidget spinner” phase this spring, when the digital artist Beeple sold an NFT at Christie's for $69 million. Google searches \u003ca href=\"https://trends.google.com/trends/explore?q=NFT\u0026geo=US\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eflagged\u003c/a\u003e for months after, but interest has climbed back up since...perhaps best exemplified by an NFT of a rock selling for over \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/23/justin-sun-buys-nft-rock-half-million-dollars?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehalf a mil\u003c/a\u003e at the end of August.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlus, it’s not just your old college roommate who believes NFTs have a bright future.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eVisa \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-23/cryptopunk-nft-prices-visa-buys-digital-avatar-7610-for-150-000-in-eth?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplanted its flag\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in the NFT world this summer by purchasing a CryptoPunk—a unique digital avatar—for $150,000 worth of ethereum.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFacebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg thinks NFTs could be a ubiquitous part of the metaverse he’s intent on building.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSkeptics say the NFT space is plagued by scams and is essentially a hype bubble ready to burst.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Coinbase’s stock has fallen 27% since it went public in April, as competitors like Robinhood crowd into crypto trading and regulators bare their teeth. Coinbase NFT marks the company’s second shot at finding a new revenue stream in about a month, after the SEC scrapped its last launch—a crypto lending product called Lend.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eanyone can join Coinbase’s waitlist for its NFT marketplace, which the company plans to \u003ca href=\"https://www.coinbase.com/nft/announce?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunch this year\u003c/a\u003e. *Adds \u003cem\u003ePudgy Penguin\u003c/em\u003e to Christmas style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMad Men\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e4.3 million people \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/business-459c0884721a213985cdf0185a1176f8?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003equit their jobs\u003c/a\u003e in the US in August, the Labor Department said yesterday. That’s an astronomical amount—the most on record—and represents nearly 3% of the workforce.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhere are workers \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/10/12/jolts-workers-quitting-august-pandemic/?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003equitting the most\u003c/a\u003e?\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e892,000 workers left restaurants, bars, and hotels.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e721,000 left their retail gigs.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e706,000 ditched their jobs in professional business services and 534,000 in health care and social assistance.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s going on? \u003c/strong\u003eIn an economy where jobs are plentiful and the people to fill them are scarce, workers are finding themselves with much more leverage. If their jobs are uber stressful, require long hours for low pay, and pose a greater risk of contracting Covid-19, there’s little incentive to stick around. Just look at the number of people quitting the hospitality and retail industries.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThis is all a major headache for employers, who have to raise wages and dangle more benefits to find anyone to work for them. Businesses had 10.4 million job openings in the country in August, down from July’s record of 11.1 million but still extremely elevated.\u003cem\u003e—NF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWell, they didn’t put it exactly like that. But in a draft statement, the US Preventive Services Task Force, a leading group of medical experts, did say that people age 60 or over should \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/12/health/aspirin-heart-attack-stroke.html?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estop taking\u003c/a\u003e a daily regimen of low-dose aspirin to prevent heart disease or stroke.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBecause aspirin acts as a blood thinner to prevent blood clots, it also increases the risk of life-threatening bleeding. So the panel decided that the potential side effects for older folks taking aspirin daily as a preventative measure outweigh the benefits.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThis announcement isn’t exactly a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/10/12/health/daily-aspirin-heart-disease-stroke-draft-recommendation-wellness/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurprise\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, and comes after a number of medical organizations, such as the American Heart Association, said older Americans without high risk of heart disease should forgo daily low-dose style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eVanMoof, the Dutch e-bike manufacturer, will begin selling a high-speed bike called the VanMoof V in late 2022, the company announced Tuesday. Maxing out at \u003ca href=\"https://www.vanmoof.com/en-US/vanmoof-v?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e37 mph\u003c/a\u003e, the V is gonna be huge for those of us with dreams of one day cheating to win the Tour de France.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne potential hiccup: The V’s 37-mph speed is significantly faster than the legal limit for e-bikes in any US state with a law currently on the books (some states have no limit at all). In a press release, the company said it “intends to work with city governments to explore solutions from geofencing to revised speed regulations.” Basically a “do first, ask forgiveness after they’ve seen us do a wheelie on this hog” kind of thing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e The e-bike market is expected to reach \u003ca href=\"https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2021/04/06/2204781/0/en/Global-e-bike-market-size-to-reach-USD-48-46-billion-by-2028.html?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$48 billion\u003c/a\u003e globally by 2028. E-bike sales in the US  increased \u003ca href=\"https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2021/03/electric-bicycles-sales-growth/?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e145%\u003c/a\u003e between 2019 and 2020, and grew \u003ca href=\"https://electrek.co/2021/10/05/electric-bicycle-sales-are-growing16x-higher-than-general-cycling-heres-why/?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e240%\u003c/a\u003e in the 12 months leading up to July 2021. For context, that’s 16x faster growth than general cycling.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe VanMoof V will retail for approximately $3,600, and deliveries are expected to start in late 2022.—\u003cem\u003eMK\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\"
